path_1.title: Gladiator (2000)
path_1.feeling: Stirring old-school heroism and battle spectacle hit my sweet spot.

path_1.title: Finding Nemo (2003)
path_1.feeling: Warm, funny, and heartfelt family adventure that never talks down.

path_1.title: Pinocchio (1940)
path_1.feeling: Classic moral fable with craftsmanship I admire and a timeless heart.

path_1.title: Christmas Story, A (1983)
path_1.feeling: Nostalgic and gently funny, even if a bit slight.

path_1.title: Big Chill, The (1983)
path_1.feeling: Well-acted but a little self-absorbed for my taste.

path_1.title: They Live by Night (1949)
path_1.feeling: Tender, doomed romance wrapped in lean crime drama—my kind of classic.

path_1.title: Inconvenient Truth, An (2006)
path_1.feeling: More sermon than cinema for me.

path_1.title: Hustler, The (1961)
path_1.feeling: Tough, character-driven drama with real grit and consequence.

path_1.title: Brazil (1985)
path_1.feeling: Inventive, but the surreal cynicism keeps me at arm’s length.

path_1.title: Maltese Falcon, The (1941)
path_1.feeling: Sharp, no-nonsense noir that still crackles.

path_1.title: Alien (1979)
path_1.feeling: Tense and atmospheric, if more creature feature than I favor.

path_1.title: Secret Window (2004)
path_1.feeling: Moody setup, but the twisty psych-games feel thin.

path_1.title: Big Country, The (1958)
path_1.feeling: Interesting peek behind a favorite, though the making-of angle only goes so far.

path_1.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious and heartfelt, yet overreaches and leaves me cool.

path_1.title: Manchurian Candidate, The (2004)
path_1.feeling: Solid paranoid thriller, if a bit on-the-nose.

path_1.title: Appaloosa (2008)
path_1.feeling: Unfussy Western with sturdy values and sturdy leads.

path_1.title: Spy Game (2001)
path_1.feeling: Crisp, professional spycraft with satisfying momentum.

path_1.title: River Runs Through It, A (1992)
path_1.feeling: Quiet, handsome, and reflective, with steady emotional undercurrents.

path_1.title: Unbroken (2014)
path_1.feeling: Inspiring endurance tale told with restraint, if somewhat conventional.

path_1.title: Roger & Me (1989)
path_1.feeling: Smug and heavy-handed

path_1.title: Hannibal (2001)
path_1.feeling: Glossy but grisly

path_1.title: Gone Baby Gone (2007)
path_1.feeling: Tough moral knots handled with clarity and heart.

path_1.title: Slumdog Millionaire (2008)
path_1.feeling: Engaging, but the contrived framework keeps me at a distance.

path_1.title: Field of Dreams (1989)
path_1.feeling: Earnest Americana that lands its father-son grace notes.

path_1.title: Die Hard (1988)
path_1.feeling: Lean, witty, and crowd-pleasing action done right.

path_1.title: Office Space (1999)
path_1.feeling: Dryly funny workplace jab that amuses more than it endures.

path_1.title: Enemy of the State (1998)
path_1.feeling: Propulsive and tidy techno-thrills with a satisfying payoff.

path_1.title: St. Elmo's Fire (1985)
path_1.feeling: Glossy growing pains that feel shallow.

path_1.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring (2003)
path_1.feeling: Elegant and restrained, with a quiet emotional pull.

path_1.title: Three Days of the Condor (3 Days of the Condor) (1975)
path_1.feeling: Taut, grown-up thriller with brains and stakes.
